item.title: Kelly add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "If music be the food of love, play on, Give me excess of it; that surfeiting, The appetite may sicken, and so die." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Brigham Young
item.description: "You educate a man; you educate a man. You educate a woman; you educate a generation." -- Brigham Young

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Claire Fagin
item.description: "Knowledge will bring you the opportunity to make a difference." -- Claire Fagin

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Thomas Huxley
item.description: "Sit down before fact as a little child, be prepared to give up every preconceived notion, follow humbly wherever and to whatever abysses nature leads, or you shall learn nothing. I have only begun to learn content and peace of mind since I have resolved at all risks to do this." -- Thomas Huxley

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "Education is our passport to the future, for tomorrow belongs to the people who prepare for it today." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Brigham Young
item.description: "Education is the power to think clearly, the power to act well in the world's work, and the power to appreciate life." -- Brigham Young

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West
